howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Create your perfect binaural beats session in just a few simple steps

step1.title: Create Custom Session
step1.description: Start with a blank canvas or choose from bundled examples. Name your session and set the duration.

step2.title: Add Multiple Track Types
step2.description: Layer binaural beats, monaural beats, isochronic tones, noise generators, or import your own audio files. Choose from soothing background sounds including white noise, pink noise, brown noise, distant rain, old record, and ocean surf. Import your own audio files in MP3, WAV, or FLAC format for timed sample playback.

step3.title: Adjust Frequencies & Volumes
step3.description: Set carrier frequencies (80-600 Hz) and beat frequencies (0.5-40 Hz) to match your sensitivity. Control track volumes and add volume envelopes.

step4.title: Preview & Save
step4.description: Test your session with preview playback before saving. Make adjustments until it's perfect for you.

step5.title: Share via QR Code
step5.description: Generate a QR code to share your session instantly. Scan codes from others to discover new sessions, then customize them to your preferences.

howItWorks.title: How Brainwave Entrainment Works
howItWorks.subtitle: The science behind the transformation
howItWorks.explanation: When you listen to two slightly different frequencies (one in each ear), your brain naturally perceives a third frequency—the difference between them. This is called a binaural beat. Your brain then synchronizes its own electrical activity to match this perceived frequency, a phenomenon known as brainwave entrainment.
howItWorks.noHeadphones: MindState also supports monaural beats and isochronic tones, which work without headphones. Monaural beats are created by mixing two frequencies before they reach your ears, while isochronic tones use evenly spaced pulses of a single tone. Both can effectively entrain your brainwaves when played through speakers, making it easy to enjoy the benefits during meditation, work, or sleep—no headphones required.
howItWorks.personalization: Different frequencies unlock different mental states: Delta (0.5-4 Hz) for deep sleep, Theta (4-8 Hz) for meditation and creativity, Alpha (8-13 Hz) for relaxed focus, Beta (13-30 Hz) for active concentration, and Gamma (30-100 Hz) for peak performance. By personalizing carrier frequencies and beat frequencies to match your unique sensitivity, you can maximize the benefits and achieve your desired mental state more effectively.

safety.title: Safe & Well-Studied
safety.subtitle: Binaural beats are generally safe for most people when used responsibly
safety.general: Binaural beats have been studied for decades and are considered safe for the majority of users. They work through natural brainwave entrainment and don't require any invasive procedures or substances.
safety.precautions: If you have epilepsy or a history of seizures, consult with a healthcare provider before use. Keep volume at comfortable levels—excessive volume can cause hearing damage. If you experience any discomfort, discontinue use. Binaural beats are not a replacement for medical treatment or professional mental health care.

research.title: Backed by Research
research.subtitle: Scientific studies support the benefits of binaural beats and brainwave entrainment
research.findings: Research has shown that binaural beats can help reduce anxiety, improve focus, enhance meditation practice, and support better sleep. Studies have found positive effects on relaxation, stress reduction, and cognitive performance. While individual results may vary, the scientific evidence continues to grow, supporting the use of binaural beats as a tool for mental enhancement and well-being.

metaAnalysis.title: Meta-Analysis: Cognition, Anxiety & Pain
metaAnalysis.description: A comprehensive analysis of 22 studies found medium, significant effects on memory, attention, anxiety, and pain perception (effect size g = 0.45).

anxiety.title: Anxiety & Quality of Life Study
anxiety.description: Daily exposure to delta-frequency binaural beats over 60 days showed significant decreases in trait anxiety and increases in quality of life.

memory.title: Memory Enhancement Research
memory.description: Research found that alpha, beta, and gamma binaural beats can modulate cortical networks and improve short-term memory performance.

tinnitus.title: Tinnitus Management Study
tinnitus.description: A randomized controlled trial found that alpha-frequency binaural beats combined with music therapy led to significant improvements in chronic tinnitus.
